FuncDef:
The offline-speed command configures the user offline speed, specifically, the number of users that go offline within a second. If the number of users to go offline within a second exceeds the configured value, the users that cannot go offline enter the offline queue.
The undo offline-speed command restores the default configuration.
By default, a maximum of 256 users can go offline within a second.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of users that go offline within a second.
The value is an integer ranging from 50 to 256, in users per second.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If the user offline speed is too high, the CPU is overloaded. To dynamically control the user offline speed, run the offline-speed command to configure the offline speed. By doing so, you can limit CPU usage.
Configuration Impact
The configured offline speed takes effect for all users, regardless of their types, including PPP and IPoE, their address types, including IPv4, IPv6, and IPv4/IPv6 dual-stack, or their offline reasons.
If the offline-speed command is run more than once, the latest configuration overrides the previous one.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
